data.title: Emmy winners list: 'The Bear', 'Succession' win as 'The Last of Us,' 'Ted Lasso' shut out
data.text:
With six awards each, the Roy clan of "Succession" and the found family of “The Bear” were the Emmys' biggest winners. The HBO family dramedy and FX comedy dominated the 75th Primetime Emmy Awards, including a best drama win for “Succession” and a best comedy win for “The Bear.”

Or was the biggest winner really Elton John, who joined the ultra exclusive EGOT club with his win for outstanding variety special for "Elton John: Farewell From Dodger Stadium"? Either way, TV's biggest night came back in a big way Monday.

Another series that enjoyed Emmy gold is Netflix’s “Beef,” which earned five awards. The Lee Sung Jin-helmed miniseries, which won best limited/anthology series, earned stars Ali Wong and Steven Yeun awards for lead actress and lead actor in a limited series/TV movie.

“Succession” and “The Last of Us,” HBO’s post-apocalyptic action-drama, were the top contenders this year, entering the show with 27 and 24 nominations, respectively. Neither “The Last of Us” nor fan-favorite "Ted Lasso," which had 21 nods, took home any prizes during Monday's broadcast, though "Last of Us" nabbed two guest acting awards in last week's Creative Arts ceremonies.

This year’s Emmy Awards were postponed from Sept. 18, 2023 due to the dual writers and actors strikes. The pause marked the most significant delay of the Emmys since 2001.

Here are the biggest winners of the night (in bold):

Best drama series

"Andor" (Disney+)

"Better Call Saul" (AMC)

"House of the Dragon" (HBO)

"The Crown" (Apple TV+)

"The Last of Us" (HBO)

“The White Lotus” (HBO)

WINNER: "Succession" (HBO)

"Yellowjackets" (Showtime)

Best comedy series

"Abbott Elementary" (ABC)

"Barry" (HBO)

"Only Murders in the Building" (Hulu)

"Ted Lasso" (Apple TV+)

WINNER: "The Bear” (FX)

"Jury Duty" (Freevee)

"The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" (Amazon)

"Wednesday" (Netflix)
